    modules/data/ivx-io/enhancer.inputs.buttons.js

    /**
 * Creates enhanced button data through buttonData from the original data 
 * set, the current buttons array and options defined in this inputs data.
 */
export class iVXioInputButtonEnhancer {
    
    /**
     * Pulls out the options, buttonData and buttons from
     * various data sources to make creating a buttons array
     * easier.
     * 
     * @param {object} inputData - input data from iVXio's option input 
     * data object.
     * @param {array} inputData.options - value and displays for each
     * option in this options input.
     * @param {object} inputInfo - information from the settings about this
     * input;
     * @param {object} inputInfo.buttonData - holds the old data format for storing customized
     * button informaiton.
     * @param {array} inputInfo.buttons - array of button data that creates a button input.
     */
    constructor(inputData, inputInfo) {
        let {options} = inputData;
        let {buttonData, buttons} = inputInfo;
        
        /**
         * Collection of displays and values from iVXio used in 
         * options inputs.
         * @type {array}
         */
        this.options = options;
        
        /**
         * An object holding older version of this button's data 
         * @type {object}
         */
        this.buttonData = buttonData;
        
        /**
         * Collection of button data iVXjs can use 
         * @type {array}
         */
        this.inputButtons = buttons;

    }
    
    /**
     * Returns enhance button data to be used by iVXjs.
     * @type {array}
     */
    get buttons() {

        let {inputButtons, buttonData, options} = this;
        let existingButtons = this.extractButtonsFromButtonData(inputButtons, buttonData);
        let newButtons = this.createButtons(options, existingButtons);

        return newButtons;

    }
    
    /**
     * Creates the buttons data for iVXjs by converting the current
     * options into a button data object and adding it to the existing 
     * buttons.
     * 
     * @param {array} options - value and displays for options from iVXio's
     * option input.
     * @param {array} existingButtons - button data that is already enhanced to be 
     * used with iVXjs.
     * @return {array} - button data that is usable by iVXjs. 
     */
    createButtons(options = [], existingButtons) {
        return options.map((option, index) => {
            let {value, display} = option;
            let buttonExists = existingButtons.find((buttonData) => {
                return buttonData.value === value;
            });

            if (buttonExists) return buttonExists;

            return {
                value: value === "yes" || value === "no" ? value === "yes" : value,
                label: display
            }
        });
    }
    
    /**
     * The settings for buttons use to be an object called buttonData. This pulls
     * that data from those settings and adds it to the existing buttons array.
     * 
     * @param {array} buttons - collection of button data that can be used by iVXjs
     * @param {object} buttonData - collection of button data used by previous versions.
     * @return {array} - buttons data that can be used by iVXjs.
     */
    extractButtonsFromButtonData(buttons = [], buttonData = {}) {

        let buttonValues = Object.keys(buttonData);

        let buttonArray = buttonValues.reduce((addedButtons, buttonValue, index) => {
            let thisButtonData = buttonData[buttonValue];
            let buttonExists = buttons.find((thisButtonData) => {
                return thisButtonData.value === buttonValue;
            });

            if (buttonExists) return addedButtons;

            let newButtonValue = {
                value: buttonValue,
                labelHTML: thisButtonData.label
            };

            addedButtons.push(newButtonValue);

            return addedButtons;

        }, buttons);

        return buttonArray;

    }
};
    Generated by ESDoc(0.4.7)
